Package com.dev.sweproject

Class FirebaseService

java.lang.Object
com.dev.sweproject.FirebaseService
@Service public class FirebaseService extends Object
The `FirebaseService` class provides service methods related to the database (DB). It utilizes `CompletableFuture<\Object>` for handling asynchronous operations and representing future results. This class is part of the `java.util.concurrent` package and is used when you want to retrieve a result once it's available or handle an error if the operation fails.

Note: The Firebase API for Java used to primarily rely on Tasks, which have since been deprecated, and `CompletableFuture` is one of the recommended alternatives.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • FirebaseService

      @Autowired public FirebaseService(com.google.firebase.FirebaseApp firebaseApp)
      Creates an instance of the Firebase Service.
      Parameters:
      firebaseApp - A `FirebaseApp` object representing the Firebase configuration.

  • Method Details

    • getDatabaseReference

      public com.google.firebase.database.DatabaseReference getDatabaseReference()
      Returns a reference to the Firebase Realtime Database. If multiple clients are using this service, it will provide the same database reference instance.
      Returns:
      A reference to the Firebase Realtime Database.

    • addEntry

      public CompletableFuture<Object> addEntry(String collectionName, String key, Object value)
      Add an entry to the specified collection with the key-value association provided.
      Parameters:
      collectionName - A String denoting which collection this entry belongs to.
      key - A String denoting the key for the association.
      value - An object representing the value to be added.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes with the value upon successful addition or completes exceptionally with an error message.

    • removeEntry

      public CompletableFuture<String> removeEntry(String collectionName, String key)
      Remove an entry from the specified collection with the given key.
      Parameters:
      collectionName - A String denoting which collection this entry belongs to.
      key - A String denoting the key for the entry to be removed.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes with a success message upon successful removal or completes exceptionally with an error message.

    • createCollection

      public CompletableFuture<String> createCollection(String collectionName)
      Create a collection in the database with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      collectionName - A String representing the name of the collection to be created.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes with the collection name upon successful creation or completes exceptionally with an error message.

    • deleteCollection

      public CompletableFuture<String> deleteCollection(String collectionName)
      Delete a collection from the database with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      collectionName - A String representing the name of the collection to be deleted.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes with the collection name upon successful deletion or completes exceptionally with an error message.

    • updateEntry

      public CompletableFuture<Object> updateEntry(String collectionName, String key, Object newValue)
      Update an entry in the specified collection with the provided key : value association.
      Parameters:
      collectionName - A String denoting which collection this entry belongs to.
      key - A String denoting the key for the association to be updated.
      newValue - An object representing the new value to be assigned.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that completes with the new value upon successful update or completes exceptionally with an error message.

    • getEntry

      public CompletableFuture<Object> getEntry(String collectionName, String key)
      Retrieves the value associated with the specified collection and key.
      Parameters:
      collectionName - A String denoting which collection this entry belongs to.
      key - A String denoting the key for the association to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that will be completed with the retrieved value or completes exceptionally with an error message if the value is not found.

    • generateNetworkId

      public String generateNetworkId()
      Generates a unique network ID to use.
      Returns:
      A String containing the unique network ID.

    • searchForDocument

      public CompletableFuture<com.google.firebase.database.DataSnapshot> searchForDocument(String collectionName, String title)
      Searches for a specific document within Firebase.
      Parameters:
      collectionName - A String representing the name of the collection to search in.
      title - A String representing the title of the document to search for.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture object that may contain a DataSnapshot if the document is found, or null.

    • uploadFile

      public CompletableFuture<Object> uploadFile(org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file, String collectionName, String fileName, String userId) throws IOException
      Uploads a file to Firebase and stores it as a document in the specified collection.
      Parameters:
      file - The MultipartFile representing the file to be uploaded.
      collectionName - A String representing the name of the collection to upload the file to.
      fileName - A String representing the name of the file.
      userId - A String representing the user ID.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture object that may complete with a result upon successful upload or an error message.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an IO error occurs during the upload process.
